At the same time, Lok raises pigs and a couple of cows for future sale as well as for additional income. She lives happily with her family in a small village in Siem Reap province.

Lok would like to have a vehicle for home use; it would provide good transportation service for her family and help reduce some household expenditures. As a result, she is seeking a loan in the sum of 500 USD to purchase a motorcycle both for home use and business. This will contribute to bettering her living status. For her future plans, Lok wants to save money to expand her farming business and wishes to provide her children with higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle both for home use and business.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis  de 42 años de edad  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 19 y 24 años. Su experiencia de negocios nació vendiendo mercancía en el departamento de la Guajira, hermoso lugar ubicado al norte de Colombia. Desde hace 5 años llegó a la ciudad de Cartagena y emprendió su propia aventura de negocios, vendiendo productos variados de necesidad doméstica, pero su inclinación hacia el arte la direccionaron hacia la lencería, como hoy lo hace; ella fabrica hermosos cubrelechos, guardarropas, adornos de cocina, baño y comedor, que  vende a crédito y de contado, a clientes por encargo, mientras ella cada tres días les responde. Denis atiende su negocio desde las 2:00 de la tarde hasta las 11:00 de la noche, sus clientes son principalmente mujeres, amas de casa y empleadas; ella quiere incursionar en un mercado menos doméstico y requiere mejorar su proceso de acabado, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una fileteadora, una máquina de fotografía y materiales e insumos  como telas e hilos para el desarrollo y perfeccionamiento de su actividad. Con su credikiva planea lograr el éxito y abrir su oferta en almacenes y establecimientos comerciales, pues sueña con ver sus productos exhibidos por todas partes y más adelante tener su propio punto comercial, pues ha programado que sus hijos termines sus carreras universitarias, y todo esto lo logrará gracias a sus esfuerzos y los de su cónyuge, con quien está de acuerdo para potenciarle a sus hijos un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Denis is 42 and lives in Cartagena with her husband and two children ages 19 and 24. Her first business experience was selling merchandise in Guajira department, a beautiful place in northern Colombia. She came to Cartagena 5 years ago and started her own business selling various household items; however, she was more interested in art and started making fine linens, which she does today. She makes bedspreads, clothing, and kitchen, bath, and dining room accessories that she sells for cash or credit upon receiving the customer's order, which she fills in three days. 

Denis works from 2:00 p.m. until 11:00 p.m., and most of her customers are women, homemakers and employees. She wants to sell to market professionals and needs to upgrade her finishing process. Therefore, she is seeking her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy an overlock sewing machine, a camera, and materials and supplies such as fabric and thread to develop and improve her work. With her Kiva loan, she plans to be successful and offer her merchandise to department stores and commercial venues. She dreams of seeing her merchandise displayed everywhere and eventually have her own store. She is determined that her children finish college, and she will achieve all this through her and her husband's efforts, as he agrees that education will bring success to their children.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, a camera, and materials and supplies such as fabric and thread to develop and improve her work.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is an iron-smith and makes iron boxes on order.

With the loan investment he will buy iron and other tools to make better quality iron boxes and increase his profits.

He has been operating his business for many years and his boxes have high demand in the city due to their quality and durability.

Shahida is confident that her husband will successfully be able to improve his income after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy iron for her husband's iron box-making business

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a very active lady and performs her household tasks very well by staying at home.

She has eight children. Six of them are studying while the remaining two are not of school-going age yet.

Her husband sells breakfast. His shop is located in the nearby market and he sells a breakfast dish called nan chanay.

Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy breakfast-making ingredients in a larger quantity, which will help him prepare better quality and quantity of breakfast for his clients.

He will also increase the sitting arrangement at his shop to offer better services to his clients.

He is very experienced in his business and Shazia is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her husband's breakfast-making and -selling business

loans.name: Merys Altagracia

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 31,500 pesos Merys ha podido comprar telas y materiales para su negocio de decoración. Merys se dedica a la confección de colchas, edredones, cortinas, tapizar muebles y confección de gorras como la que muestra en la foto. Merys tiene 8 años de estar desarrollando este negocio y es una apasionada de la buena calidad en la terminación de sus productos así como de la combinación de materiales nuevos con reciclados.
Merys es casada y su esposo es líder de grupo de una fábrica de ropa. Tienen 2 hijos de 12 y 2 años. El mayor está en la escuela. 
Merys desea diseñar más variedad de gorras y sombreros y su mayor sueño es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Merys was able to use the money from 31,500 peso loan to buy fabric and supplies for her decoration business.  Merys makes bedspreads, quilts, curtains, recovers furniture, and makes hats like the one she is wearing in the picture.  Merys has been developing this business for eight years and she is passionate about the good quality of her completed products and the combination of new and recycled materials.

Merys is married and her husband leads a group that makes clothing.  They have two children ages 12 and 2.  The oldest attends school. 

Merys would like a greater variety of hats and caps and her greatest dream is to build her home.

loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en: Gilda is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. Gilda has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Gilda became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Gilda hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru:
Дилшод родился 1990 году в районе Вахш. Он живет с женой. Дилшод с 14 лет занимается торговлей. Раньше он помогал своим родителям. Торговля является семейным бизнесом. 
Сейчас у Дилшода свой собственный бизнес. У него имеется продуктовый магазин, где он работает продавцом. 
Дилшод просит кредит для закупа кондитерских, хлебобулочных изделий, напитков, молочных продуктов, а также приобретения холодильника для хранения молочных продуктов.
texts.en:
Dilshod was born in 1990 in the Vahsh region. He lives with his wife. Dilshod has been engaged in trade since he was 14 years old. Previously, he helped his parents. Trade is the family business. 

Now Dilshod has his own business. He has a grocery store where he works as a shopkeeper. 
 
Dilshod is askinf for a loan to buy confections, baked goods, beverages, and dairy products, and to acquire a refrigerator to store dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase confections, baked goods, beverages, and dairy products, and to acquire a refrigerator

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Elsa has a store that sells viand, like fried chicken. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for cooking viand.

Elsa became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viand

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson de 58 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena  con su cónyuge, tiene 6 hijos en las edades de 7 a 32 años y con ellos sueña verlos convertidos en personas exitosas.  Desde hace 40 años deriva su experiencia de la panadería, oficio que aprendiere cuando trabajó como empleado de un negocio cercano; sola hasta hace 18 años inició su propia aventura empresarial con ahorro y muchos sueños . Así fue compró sus primeros equipos de trabajo y empezó a producir en pequeñas cantidades y con mucho esfuerzo, pero muy pronto su  capacidad de trabajo y disciplina, dieron sus primeros frutos y 3 años después, consiguió  un buen local  donde su negocio creció y también ha logrado un nuevo punto productivo comercial, que es atendido por su esposa. Nelson en su proceso productivo y de comercialización es apoyado por un empleado: el mismo compra las materias primas e insumos, el empleado trabaja en las tareas de preparación, mezcla, amasado, horneo  apoyado por Nelson, quien además empaca y ubica en los puntos comerciales y finalmente atiende la venta.  Sus compras las realiza una parte de contado en la ciudad de Cartagena y una parte a crédito y se los envían desde la ciudad de Barranquilla a 2 horas de su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una vitrina exhibidora de tortas y panes, para darle una mejor presentación y exhibir sus productos en un ambiente de alegría, especialmente para los festivos, época en la cual sus ventas se incrementan. Su meta mas adelante es comprar su propia vivienda y está trabajando con mucho entusiasmo para lograrlo al lado de su cónyuge y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelson, 58, lives in the city of Cartagena with his spouse.  He has six children, ages 7 to 32, and he dreams of seeing them become successful people.  He has worked for 40 years in the bakery business, a trade he learned when he was an employee of a nearby business.

He began his own business 18 years ago with savings and a lot of dreaming.  That was how he bought his first equipment and began to bake in small quantities with a lot of hard work.  His work ethic and discipline quickly bore fruit and three years later he got a good space where his business grew.  He also has a new store that his wife takes care of.

Nelson has an employee to help him with sales.  He himself buys the raw materials and supplies, and helps the employee do the preparation, mixing, kneading, and baking.  Nelson also packs the products, delivers them for sale, and works in the store.

Currently he is applying for a Kiva loan with which he will buy a display case for pastry and bread, to present them better and display his products in a pleasant environment, especially for the holidays, when his sales increase.

His long-term goal is to buy his own home, and he is working with a lot of enthusiasm to achieve this with his spouse and children.

loans.use: to buy a display case for pastry and bread.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Баром- молодой мужчина, со средним образованием.Живет в  сельской местности и занимается откормом скота на дому.Он все свою жизнь держит скот  это занятие является основным занятием в этих местах.У Бахрома дополнительно есть другой доход он автомаляр и в сезон занимается покраской машин.С нашей организацией Бахром сотрудничает более трёх лет и все кредиты использует на откорм скота и всегда целенаправленно  использует все кредиты.На полученный кредит Бахром хочет купить скот и увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Bahrom is a young man with a secondary education. He lives in a rural area and is engaged in fattening livestock at his home. All his life he has tended cattle. This is the main occupation in these parts. In addition, Bahrom has other income: he has an autoshop and in season he deals with painting cars. 

Bahrom has been working with our organization for more than three years and all his loans have been used for fattening livestock and he always uses all the loans with purpose. With his received loan, Bahrom wants to buy cattle to increase the number of his livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Tursunmurod

texts.ru:
Турсунмурод очень трудолюбивый и умный человек. У него высшее экономическое образование. Ему 64 года. Турсунмурод вдовец. У него двое детей. Его сыновья работают в дехканском хозяйстве. 
Турсунмурод занимается выращиванием овощей и бахчевых культур. Он работает усердно и получает хороший урожай. Кроме того Турсунмурод занимается скотоводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности Турсунмурод занимается 16 лет. 
Турсунмурод просит кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Tursunmurod is a very hardworking and intelligent man. He has a degree in economics. He is 64 years old and a widower. He has two children. His work in an orchard. 

Tursunmurod is involved in growing vegetables and melons. He works hard and gets a good crop. He is also engaged in animal husbandry. He breeds cattle for sale in the future. He has been engaged in these activities for 16 years. 

Tursunmurod is asking for a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy bulls and calves

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Anita  has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. 

Anita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Anita hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita  is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children.  Rosita has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan of  4,000PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Rosita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rosita hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy T-shirts, blouses, trousers and sandals.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es: Diana de 25 años de edad es una mujer casada que tiene dos hijos en las edades de 6 y 8 años., los cuales impulsan e inspiran su hacer  día a día.  Desde hace 4 años Diana empezó a vender calzado informal femenino en un mercado doméstico, aprovechando que su esposo es fabricante de este producto y poco a poco fue obteniendo utilidades, que le permitieron ahorrar y comprar una vitrina en la cual exhibirlos. Su hermana estudiante de tecnología, le enseñó a usar el computador y a acceder a la red de internet, allí encontró oportunidades de convertir este conocimiento en un negocio que le generara un poco mas de recursos,  para aumentar sus ingresos. Así fue como adecuó su sala y la convirtió en un café internet con dos computadores,  para sus vecinas mas cercanas; con este pequeño negocio impactó en su barrio, por eso le agregó transcripciones, luego mas computadores, servicio de llamadas y videojuegos. Hoy es necesario ampliar su negocio, para atender su creciente  demanda y lograr aun más ingresos. Actualmente el negocio de producción de calzado de su esposo lo integra a sus actividades, porque ella invierte en materias primas e insumos y su esposo realiza los hermosos diseños, y fábrica el calzado, que al final Diana vende entre su clientela.  Sus compras las realiza de contado en almacenes especializados en calzado y sus proveedores de internet son 3. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cuerina, pegantes, suelas, e insumos para que su esposo desarrolle con creatividad, múltiples sandalias que sus clientes le han encargado. Con esta inversión dará respuesta oportuna a sus compradores y poco a poco logrará aumentar sus ventas, las que al final se convierten en bienestar para su familia, por quien ella y su esposo trabajan persistentemente..
texts.en:
Diana is 25 years old and a married woman with two children of the ages of 6 and 8 years old.  They motivate her and inspire her to work every day.  About four years ago, Diana began to sell informal women's shoes from a shop in her home, taking advantage of the fact that her husband is a maker of these goods, and little by little gaining profits, which allowed her to save up and buy a glass cabinet to show off her goods.

Her sister is a technology student and taught her to use a computer and to access the internet, and there she found many opportunities to take the business knowledge that she has and use it to generate greater profits, increasing her income.  That is why she converted her living room into an internet cafe with two computers for the use of her nearby neighbors.  This small business had a large impact on her neighborhood, so she has added a transcription service, then more computers, a calling service, and video games.

Today, she feels the need to increase the size of her business to meet her customers' growing demand and to obtain a better income.  Currently, her husband's business of footwear production is also a part of her daily activities, as she invests in prime quality materials and supplies and her husband creates the beautiful designs and fabricates the shoes that Diana sells to her customers.  She makes her purchases in specialty stores for cobbling and has three internet suppliers as well.

She is applying for a micro-loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy patent leather, heels, soles, and other supplies so that her husband can creatively develop a variety of sandals to the specifications of her customers' requests.  With this investment, it will be an opportunity to fulfill her customers' needs quickly and to slowly increase her sales, which has the end result of greater well-being for her family.  A goal that she and her husband consistently work toward.

loans.use: to buy patent leather, heels, soles, and other inputs to construct sandals.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en: Paulita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. Paulita  has a food/retail shop (sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Paulita  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Paulita hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en: Reynaldo is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children. Reynaldo is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP4,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.  Reynaldo has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Reynaldo hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Yokubjon

texts.ru:
Ёкубчон проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Ему 37 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Ёкубчон занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает канцелярские товары. Торговлей Ёкубчон занимается более пяти лет. 
Кроме того Ёкубчон у себя дома разводит крупнорогатый скот. Сейчас у него дома три быка. 
Ёкубчон берет кредит для приобретения канцелярских товаров и закупа телят, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара и поголовья крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Yokubjon lives in the town of Kurgantyube. He is 37 years old, married and has two children. Yokubjon is a shopkeeper. He has a shop where he sells office supplies. Yokubjon has been engaged in trade for more than five years. 

In addition, Yokubjon raises cattle at his home. Currently, he has three bulls at his home. 

Yokubjon is taking a loan for the purchase of office supplies and to buy calves, in order to increase the range of his goods and the number of his cattle.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies and to buy calves

loans.name: Tres Caminos Rio Grande Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose María, tiene  29 años de edad, está casado, vive junto con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en una aldea  que pertenece al  departamento de Intibucá. Jose ha crecido con su familia agricultora y donde vive es una zona apta para cultivos.  Hace 5 años que realiza sus propios cultivos de papa, hortalizas, maíz y frijoles y esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Esta solicitando un préstamo por  9,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar fertilizantes, abonos, semilla de papa y de habichuela para el cultivo y para darle un buen mantenimiento al mismo. Su meta es seguir trabajando para mantener su actividad productiva y para la educación de sus hijos.
El pertenece al  Grupo que se llama Tres Caminos Rio Grande, que está formado por 12 integrantes, que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma comunidad, en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda  esta doña  Tomasa de vestido azul, luego Leonarda, Jeremías, Agustina, María Asención, Santos, Pedro, Víctor, Jose María, Dionicio y don Ciriaco a la derecha de camisa color salmón, y doña María Dolores no salió en la foto. Este grupo ha trabajado juntos desde hace varios años apoyándose entre ellos.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose María is 29 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children in a neighborhood in the Department of Intibucá. Jose grew up in a farming family and lives in an area that is suitable for crops. For the past five years, he has been growing his own crops of potatoes, vegetables, corn, and beans and selling what he produces at the local market. He is requesting a loan of 9,000 HNL so that he can buy fertilizers, compost, potato seedlings, and green bean seeds for growing crops and to provide good maintenance. His goal is to continue working so that he can maintain a productive business and provide an education for his children.

Jose belongs to the group called “Tres Caminos Rio Grande”, which consists of 12 members who engage in agriculture and live in the same community. The photo shows the following members: Doña Tomasa is on the left wearing a blue dress followed by Leonarda, Jeremías, Agustina, María Asención, Santos, Pedro, Víctor, Jose María, Dionicio, and Don Ciriaco on the right who is wearing a salmon-colored shirt. Doña María Dolores is not in the photo. This group has been working together for several years and supporting one another.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, potato seedlings, and green bean seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, cooking fat and a goat to resell.

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran sells rice. She operates her business from her home and supports her family well. Her husband does a job while her eldest son is a factory worker. Her 3 remaining children are enrolled in local school and getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for further expansion of her rice business. With the loan investment, she will buy rice in bulk quantity and of better quality that will help her to increase her sales and income. She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for the past many years. She is confident that her business will be improved further after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice for rice business

loans.name: Pelan

texts.en: Pelan is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children. Pelan is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 4,000PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services. Pelan has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Pelan hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Merlina sells snacks like banana cakes and hot cakes in their local community. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients like sugar, flour and cheese for making snacks.

Merlina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlina hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is 55 years old and a mother of 2two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works in the airforce and her second son is a teacher. Her daughter sews clothes at home to support the family. All of her children are literate and have good educational background.
Khalida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for her sewing business. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine to improve her business. This will help her finishing the client orders on time and increase her income.
She isa  very experienced and skillful sewing expert and confident about her business success after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama “Mujeres Unidas 2” está en el 18 Ciclo con 20 integrantes. Gracias al trabajo que ellas hacen están saliendo adelante y se están ayudando las unas a las otras.
Maria es miembro de esta grupo, ella motiva siempre a sus compañeras para que no se desanimen y sigan trabajando juntas siempre. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y solicita el crédito para poder surtir con bebidas, lácteos, carnes, verduras y demás insumos su negocio. Agradece a Kiva y fundación paraguaya por la ayuda que esta recibiendo, pues le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The committee called “Mujeres Unidas 2” (United Women 2) is in its 18th loan cycle with 20 members. Thanks to their work, they have been able to move forward and help one another.

Maria is a member of this group. She always motivates her fellow group members to prevent them from becoming complacent and to keep them working together. Maria has a well-stocked food pantry and is requesting a loan so that she can acquire beverages, dairy products, meats, vegetables, and other items for her business. She is grateful to Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for the support she has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, meats, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Romy

texts.en:
Romy is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. 

Romy buys and sells beverages in their community. He has had this business for 9 years. He requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy more beverages to resell.

Romy has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011. In the future, Romy hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy more beverages to resell

loans.name: 71-Santa Rita Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 71-SANTA RITA está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Silvia vive por la localidad de la Limoncito,  ella tiene 24 años y tres hijos de las edad de 3, 5 y 8 años, La Sra. Silvia  se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante por distintas zonas y también mercados ofreciendo también productos de belleza por catalogo,   este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Silvia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de cosméticos que se encuentran de promoción en los catálogos ya que tiene varios pedidos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Silvia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando cosméticos por mayor y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una tienda grande donde pueda ofrecer la variedad de sus productos  y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Silvia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial banking group "71 Santa Rita" is made up of eight members, seven women and one man, and the president of the banking group is Silvia.  She lives in the locale of Limoncito, and she is 24 years old and has three children who are 3, 5, and 8 years old.  Silvia is a saleswoman of cosmetics, which she sells on foot in various zones and also in the markets offering as variety of beauty products by catalog as well.  This loan will be her third loan cycle with this institution.

Silvia will use this loan to buy cosmetics that she finds on sale in catalogs, for which she already has requests.  Her reason for wanting this loan is to continue to improve her business.  Silvia will use the benefits of the loan to continue buying cosmetics at wholesale prices to improves her margins.  Her wish for her business is to have a large shop where she would be able to offer the whole range of her products at once and thereby give better service to her customers.  Silvia is a very hardworking woman and feels happy about the opportunity she has been given as well as the other women in her group, some of whom are single mothers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics which are found to be on sale in catalogs.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman. She has 2 children ages 3 years and 4 years. She describes herself as an aggressive woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as maize, beans, black beans etc. Her business is located in a conducive business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of transportion of cereals to her business premise. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more cereals for resale. Her business goal is to venture into a wholesale retail store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have diversified her business.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for resale.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 
Eva is providing motorela or motorcycle services and her husband is the driver. She has had this business for 5  years. She requested a loan of 5,000PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.
Eva has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Eva hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Fe has a food/retail shop (sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 28 year old married man. He has a daughter who is one-year-old. He describes himself to be an aggressive man. He operates a motorcycle business where he provides transportation services to customers. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located along a busy road and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of fuel. 

David will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits for starting a new grocery store. His business goal is to expand his business by hiring a car to increase the transportation services within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have purchased more motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for a new grocery store.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Mr Kossi est âgé de 32ans. Père d’un bébé de 10 mois, il est marié à une revendeuse.  En 2004, il s’est donné à l’activité de vente de ferrailles dans une boutique. Il le vend seul à ses nombreux clients.  Pour renforcer cette activité, il sollicite de WAGES un troisième crédit et espère bien le rembourser car les deux derniers ont été soldé sans probléme. Avec les profits réalisés, il espère améliorer l’activité de sa femme. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il veut développer son activité en ouvrant des boutiques dans la ville de Lomé et permettre à son fils de s’épanouir.
texts.en: Mr. Kossi is 32 years old and the father of a 10-month old baby. His wife is a vendor. In 2004, he has started selling scrap metal from a store. He sells alone and has numerous customers. To strengthen his business, he is seeking a third loan from WAGES, hoping to repay it well, just as he has repaid two prior loans without any issues. Thanks to his profits, he hopes to boost his wife’s business. As to his long-term goals, he would like to grow his business by opening more stores in the town of Lomé as well as provide a nurturing environment for his child.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Zeenat's Group

texts.en:
Zeenat has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for her beauty parlor. With the loan investment she will buy cosmetics, creams, etc., in larger quantity and of better variety that will help her to provide better quality makeup and parlor services to her clients, and will increase her profits.
She is very experienced in her work, very knowledgeable and expert in her profession, and particularly expert in bridal makeup.
She is confident that a KIVA loan will help her make more profits from his business.

loans.use: To buy salon items for beauty parlor business

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: La socia Guillermina sigue perteneciendo al banco Comunal “Kantu” de la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien gracias a pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella sigue también dedicándose a la venta de ropa y flores en las diferentes ferias sabatinas y dominicales. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa como por ejemplo blusas, camisas, polos, chompas, casacas y ropa en general. La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Guillermina continues to participate as a member of the Communal Bank “Kantu” with Asociación Arariwa. She has done very well thanks to her timely loan payments. Guillermina continues to sell clothing and flowers at the various fairs on Saturdays and Sundays. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy clothes such as blouses, shirts, pullovers, sweaters, jackets, and other types of garments.

Guillermina is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pullovers, sweaters, jackets, and other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Samira

texts.ru: Samira zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Ona jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Samira yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjar. Samira 26 let. Ona uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya prodajey raznix tovarov (shampun, milo, krem, balzam, lasyon i t.d). Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 1500 AZN chtobi kupit noviye tovari dlya prodaji i razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Samira is 26 years old, married and has two children.  She lives in the Absheron region together with her family.  Samira is an IDP from Kalbadjar.  She has been involved in selling various merchandise (shampoo, soap, lotion, balsam, perfume, etc.) for two years.  Currently, she needs 1500 AZN to purchase new merchandise for sale and develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Khayrullo

texts.ru:
Хайрулло 30-летний женатый мужчина. У него двое детей. Хайрулло трудолюбивый и честный человек. Он уже второй раз получает кредит в нашей организации. Хайрулло зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кроме того Хайрулло получает молоко и молочные продукты, которые реализует. Его жена помогает ему в этом. 
Скотоводством Хайрулло занимается более восьми лет. 
Хайрулло просит кредит для закупа несколько голов бычков и коров.
texts.en: Khayrullo is a 30 year-old married man.  He has two children.  Khayrullo is a hardworking and honest person.  This is his second time obtaining a loan from our organization.  Khayrullo earns a living by breeding cattle.  Besides this, he gets milk and dairy products, which he sells.  His wife helps him with this.  Khayrullo has been involved in animal husbandry for over eight years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase several bulls and cows.

loans.use: to buy several bulls and cows

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Editha sells snacks in their local community. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients like flour, sugar and cheese for making snacks.

Editha has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina  está contenta y agradece a Kiva, por el servicio de crédito pues como ella dice “le sirvió de mucho para su negocio,  compró   muchas cositas como telas, un vitrinas que surtió con productos de belleza y continuó  trabajando su arte de embellecer a damas”. En la actualidad  necesita invertir porque se acercan los meses de mayor movimiento comercial para su negocio, los meses de Julio y Agosto, porque sus proveedores hacen buenas ofertas y su clientela crece. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo financiamiento con el cual comprará telas, accesorios de modistería, tintes de cabello y otros artículos que embellecen a su clientela. A este credikiva le apuesta, que será muy exitoso porque tiene nuevos pedidos y su clientela se acerca cada vez mas a utilizar sus servicios de embellecimiento, con el cual los tiene conquistados.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is happy and thanks Kiva for the previous loan, since as she said, "it has served well for the business, I was able to buy many things like fabrics, a glass cabinet which I filled with beauty products, and I continued to apply my artistry in beautifying women."  Currently, she needs to invest in her business because her busiest months for commercial growth are approaching in the months of July and August, and because her providers have great sales and her clientele is growing.

This is the reason she is getting a new loan with which she will buy fabrics, beauty accessories, hair colors, and other items to beautify her customers.  This loan she bets will be very successful because she has many new orders, and her customers use her services more and more each time they come back, so she's got this business conquered.

loans.use: To buy sewing accessories, such as laces, buttons, ribbons, buckles and appliqués; and to buy costume jewellery to stock her shop.

loans.name: Davlatali

texts.ru:
Давлатали проживает в Яванском районе. Ему 32 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Давлатали занимается разведением крупнорогатого и мелко – рогатого скота. Он имеет богатый опыт в этой сфере. Давлатали более восьми лет занимается скотоводством. 
Он берет кредит для закупа несколько голов телят и коз.
texts.en: Davlatali lives in the Yavan district.  He is 32 years old, married and has four children.  Davlatali is involved in breeding cattle and small livestock.  He has a rich experience in this field.  Davlatali has been involved in animal husbandry for over eight years.  He is requesting this loan to buy several calves and goats.

loans.use: to buy several calves and goats

loans.name: Nasir

texts.ru:
Насир 46-летний житель Яванского района. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Насир зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этот вид бизнеса является единственным источником дохода в его семье. 
Насир имеет хороший опыт в этой сфере. Он занимается скотоводством более шести лет. В этом ему помогает дети и жена. 
Насир берет кредит для закупа двух бычков.
texts.en: Nasir is a 46 year-old resident of the Yavan district.  He is married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Nasir earns a living by breeding cattle.  This business is the sole source of income for his family.  Nasir has a good experience in this field.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for over six years.  His children and wife help him with this business.  Nasir is requesting this loan to buy two bulls.

loans.use: to buy two bulls

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru: Любовь разведена, есть один взослый сын. Любовь продает детскую обувь на рынке г. Мелитополь. У не большой опыт работы и много постоянных клиентов. Люовь хочет улучшить свои жилищные условия - сделать ремонт в кухне и установить новые энергосберегающие окна.
texts.en: Lubov is divorced and has one adult son.  She sells children's shoes at a market in the city of Melitopol.  She has a lot of work experience and many regular customers.  Lubov wants to improve her living conditions by making repairs in her kitchen and installing new energy-saving windows.

loans.use: to make repairs in her kitchen

loans.name: Delmy Yaneth

texts.es:
La señora Delmy tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 19, 15 y 12 años de edad respectivamente. Ella vive solo con sus hijos que están estudiando, su esposo se encuentra trabajando en la capital del país y los tiene olvidados. Ella se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa, a la elaboración y venta de comida típica como: tamales, pupusas, chocolate, enredos, nuegados, entre otros más. Tiene cuatro años de dedicarse a esta actividad y ella considera que la va muy bien. 

Ella compra todos los materiales que necesita en los pueblos vecinos que se encuentra a 12 kilómetros de distancia de su casa, siendo su mayor dificultad que no puede comprar en grandes cantidades por falta de dinero; esto le demanda mayor cantidad de tiempo porque tiene que viajar con mayor frecuencia en busca de lo que necesita para elaborar su venta.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 4 mesas, una plancha para cocer las pupusas y materia prima. Con la finalidad de establecerse en un lugar fijo, pues ella va de casa en casa ofreciendo sus productos y por encargo, por esa razón ella quiere instalarse en su casa y que lleguen ahí sus clientes para operar de la mejor manera. Para que sus ingresos sean mayores, debido a que sus hijos están estudiando y el mayor de ellos ya esta en la universidad y su máximo sueño es ver a sus hijos con una carrera universitaria y que vivan de una manera diferente a la que ella se desarrollo, pues por falta de recursos económicos no pudo lograr su sueño de ser doctora y lo que más desea es hacer realidad ese sueño en cada uno de sus hijos con lo que han elegido estudiar.
texts.en: Ms. Delmy, 42, is married and has three children who are 19, 15 and 12 respectively. She lives alone with her children who are in school, as her husband is working in the capital city and has forgotten about them. She devotes herself to carrying out domestic duties at home and making and selling traditional foods such as tamales, pupusas, hot chocolate, fried yucca threads, and nuegados among other items. She's been in this business for four years and believes it is going very well. She purchases all the materials she needs in surrounding villages which are 12 kilometers from her house. Her greatest difficulty is not being able to buy large quantities for lack of money. So she must spend more of her time because she must travel more frequently looking for what she needs to make her products. The requested loan is for the purchase of four tables, a grill for cooking the pupusas, and raw materials, in hopes of establishing a fixed location because she now goes door to door selling her products and by order. Therefore she wants to set things up at home so her customers may come there and she may run the business better. She hopes to increase her income since her children are in school and the eldest is already at the university. Her biggest dream is to see her children with university degrees and that they would live a different life from the one she has, since for lack of economic resources she was not able to fulfill her dream of becoming a doctor. What she most wishes for is that this dream would become reality in each of her children, and so they have chosen to get some schooling.

loans.use: to purchase four tables, a grill for cooking the pupusas and raw materials.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 32-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 to 12 years. She describes herself to be an aggressive woman.

Flora operates a grocery store where she sells potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years and employs one staff member. Her business is located near a bus station and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of potatoes.

Flora will use the loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy more potatoes to resell. Her business goal is to run a wholesale grocery store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have succeeded in her business.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of potatoes to resell.

loans.name: Claudia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Claudia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo por qué considera necesario el fortalecimiento en el negocio con más capital de trabajo, conprándose los materiales como el arroz, frijoles, azúcar, papel higiénico, entre otros productos para la tienda, ya que éstos son demandados por sus clientes a diario.
El efecto que tuvo un préstamo anterior fue un crecimiento en el negocio, que le permitió generar mayores ventas y ganancias de las cuales ha cubierto los gastos de estudio en su esposo, quien actualmente ha terminado sus estudios.
texts.en:
Claudia is requesting a new loan because believes her business needs to be built up with more working capital, by buying products such as rice, beans, sugar, and toilet paper among other items for the store, since these are requested by her clientele on a daily basis. 

The effect of the previous loan was a growth in the business which allowed her to make more sales and earnings out of which the costs of her husband's studies, who currently has finished his studies, have been covered.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar and toilet paper.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Ulbosh

texts.ru:
Улбош родилась 1965 году в районе Яван. Она живет с мужем. У них шестеро детей. Ей муж имеет дехканское хозяйство, где он работает вместе со всей семьей. 
Улбош занимается животноводством. Она разводит мелко - рогатый скот у себя дома. В этой области Улбош имеет богатый опыт. Она более 13 лет занимается животноводством. 
Улбош просит кредит для закупа несколько голов овец и козлят.
texts.en: Ulbosh was born in 1965 in the Yavan district.  She lives with her husband, and they have six children.  Her husband has a dekhan farm, where he works together with the entire family.  Ulbosh is involved in animal husbandry.  She breeds small livestock at home.  Ulbosh has a rich experience in this field.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 13 years.  Ulbosh is requesting this loan to buy several sheep and young goats.

loans.use: to buy several sheep and young goats

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
Benedicta, esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación pequeña con paredes de ladrillo, la casa esta ubicada en la zona 16 de Febrero en la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudió solo hasta la primaria y actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa particular por más de diez horas al día ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia; es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora para ayudar en los estudios a sus hijos ya que les será muy útil en sus tareas diarias y con lo poco que gana no le alcanza.
El sueño de Benedicta es mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos, de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Benedicta is married and has four children who are of school age. They live in their own home where they occupy one small room with brick walls. The house is located in the February 16th District in the city of El Alto.

Benedicta only has an elementary school education. She currently earns income by working more than 10 hours a day as a housekeeper at a private residence. This enables her to cover the cost of food and basic services for her family. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy a computer to help with her children’s studies. Such an item will be useful for their daily homework, but she is not able to buy one with the little that she earns.

Benedicta dreams of improving her income so that she can cover her children’s educational expenses and provide them with a better quality of life. This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her children's studies.

loans.name: Maria Argentina

texts.es:
Maria tiene 29 años de edad, viven en unión libre, reside con su esposo en una aldea del Municipio de San Marcos, Santa Barbará el cual trabaja en una hacienda y también se desempeña en la agricultura.
Maria tiene un negocio de pulpería que inicio hace 2 años. Vende productos de la canasta básica como frijoles, arroz, harina, manteca, huevos, embutidos, lácteos, carnes etc. Maria cuenta con sus propios clientes y atiende muy bien, las ganancias que ha obtenido las ha trabajado invirtiendo el mismo.
Ella esta solicitando su primer préstamo con ODEF de 8,000 lempiras para invertir en la compra de producto que ya no tiene como carnes, lácteos y embutidos. Ya que estos son insumos necesarios y que tienen demanda  todos los días en los hogares.
Su meta es trabajar muy duro para que su pulpería sea la mejor en la zona, para satisfacer la demanda de los clientes.
texts.en:
María, 29, lives in a common law relationship with her husband in a village in the Municipality of San Marcos in Santa Bárbara.  She works in a store and also works in agriculture.

María has a business she started two years ago.  She sells basic staple items like beans, rice, flour, lard, eggs, cured meats, dairy products, meat, etc.  María has her own customers and she takes care of them well.  Profits she’s earned she’s reinvested in the store.

She’s asking ODEF for her first loan for 8000 lempiras to buy products she’s run out of like meat, dairy products and cured meats since these are necessary supplies that are in demand daily in homes.  Her goal is to work very hard so that her grocery store will be the best in the zone in order to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Ana Dilia

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 39 años de edad, una colonia periférica de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes, es casada, tiene 2 hijos.
Doña Ana es una persona muy trabajadora y conocida en la aldea, tiene 1 año de tener una pulpería (venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar, como granos básicos, carnes, embutidos, refrescos, de donde ha logrado obtener  ingresos para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.  A su negocio le dedica tiempo completo desde las. Inició esta actividad con capital propio. 
 Actualmente solicitó este préstamo a ODEF de 8,000 lempiras para incrementar sus productos en compra de granos básicos, embutidos, carnes, refrescos etc. Ya que esta pulpería es muy visitada por sus vecinos y han incrementado sus ventas. Se sacrifica con este negocio para apoyar a sus hijos con la educación.
texts.en:
Ana, 39, lives in an outlying neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.  She’s married and has two children.

Ana is a very hardworking person who is very well-known in the village.  She has had a grocery store for a year.  She sells basic staple items like basic grains, meat, cured meats, and soft-drinks.  She’s earned income that way to help her husband with household expenses.  She works full-time in her store and started it with her own capital.

She’s currently asking ODEF for an 8000 lempira loan to buy more basic grains, cured meats, meat, soft-drinks, etc. because this grocery store is visited often by her neighbors and sales have increased.  She strives with this business to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Adalicia

texts.es:
Adalicia, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita comprarse productos para su venta, por ejemplo se comprara pescado fresco, camarones de diferentes tamaños, conchas, entre otros mariscos que son necesarias para el fortalecimiento del negocio y mantener las ventas con sus clientes.

El efecto que tuvo un préstamo anterior, es que pudo aumentar sus ventas ya que comercializó mucho más pescado y camarón, esto  ocasionó una mejora en sus ingresos, de los cuales ha logrado invertir en las mejoras de una parte de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Adalicia has decided to get a new loan because she needs to buy products for her business, for example, she will buy fresh fish, shrimp of many different sizes, conchs, and other shellfish as necessary to strengthen her business and maintain her sales with her customers.

The effect of the previous loan was that she was able to increase her business and sell a lot more fish and shrimp, and this allowed her to improve her income, from which she gained funds to make improvements on a part of her home.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, shrimp of different sizes, and conchs.

loans.name: Gloria Yamileth

texts.es: Gloria tiene 33 años, soltera, vive en Puerto Cortes junto con su padre. a ella siempre le ha gustado la belleza, ya tiene 16 años de dedicarse a vender cosméticos, como ser cremas, champú, maquillaje, tintes, quita esmalte y otros, además realiza trabajos de manicure y pedicure y peinados. Actualmente tiene el negocio en su casa pero piensa rentar un local en el centro de la ciudad. El préstamo que solicita es el sexto préstamo y es por 21,000 Lempiras, el cual lo va invertir en comprar productos de belleza para surtir el negocio e incrementar las ventas. Su objetivo es seguir creciendo en el negocio para tener solvencia económica y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria, 33, is single and lives in Puerto Cortes with her father.  She’s always liked beauty and has been selling cosmetics like cream, shampoo, make-up, hair color, nail polish remover and others for 16 years now.  She also does manicures, pedicures and hair styling.  Her business is currently home-based but she’s thinking about renting a locale downtown.

The loan she’s requesting is her sixth one and it’s for 21,000 lempiras that she’ll use to buy beauty products to stock her business and increase sales.  Her goal is to continue growing the business in order to attain economic solvency and improve quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, a 50-year-old married father of seven children ranging in age from 3 to 14 years, describes himself as an honest and humble man. Employing one staff member, for the past 12 years he has been operating a restaurant serving food, tea and snacks. His business is located in a viable business environment, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area.

Now requesting this Kes 50,000 loan to buy more food ingredients, George hopes to expand his business into a hotel within five years. He aspires to continued success in the future.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for his restaurant.

loans.name: Deylin Edelma

texts.es:
la señora edelma es habitante de san rafael del sur, nicaragua. San rafael del sur es un municipio de nicaragua famoso por la elaboracion de tortillas. Es acompañada y tiene dos niños, uno de edad escolar que tiene seis años y el otro tiene veinte meses.

 Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de elaboracion de tortillas, producto muy popular en la dieta nicaraguense, que es elaborado a base de maiz nica.

 un dia de trabajo empieza a las seis de la mañana en la preparacion del maíz,y consiste en poner un recipiente con el maiz y agua y cal para suavizar el maíz. Luego procede preparar su fogon y comal. Su mercado esta ubicado en el municipio de san rafael del sur. Durante la entrevista ella expreso que este credito contribuira en ahorrar costos en la produccion de tortillas, ya que durante esta temporada se incrementara el precio del maiz.

la forma de preparacion de las tortillas es artesanal, elaborado con sus propias manos por lo que las tortillas quedan tostadas como galletas y no suaves. Doña edelma nos comento que este arte lo aprendio de su suegra y que su actividad comercial le apasiona. y este es su primer crédito con ceprodel y cree que le ayudara en gran manera en realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Edelma is a citizen of San Rafael del Sur, Nicaragua.  San Rafael del Sur is a famous municipality of Nicaragua for their tortilla making.  She is partnered and has two children, one of whom is of school age and 6 years old, and that other is just 20 months old.  

She owns a small tortilla-making business, a product which is very popular as a part of the Nicaraguan diet, which is mostly based upon Nicaraguan corn.

A day of work for her begins at six in the morning with the preparation of the corn, which consists of filling a receptacle with corn and water with lime to soften the corn kernels.  She then proceeds with the preparation of her stove and comal (a traditional skillet for cooking tortillas).  Her market is located in the municipal center of San Rafael del Sur.  During her interview, she said that this loan would contribute to her saving on the costs of making tortilla, as the price of corn has been rising.

The way that she makes her tortillas is through the traditional process, made by her own hands, so her tortillas are more toasted, similar to a cookie, rather than being soft and floppy.  Edelma tells us that this is an art form which she learned from her mother-in-law, and she feels passionate about her business.  This is her first loan with CEPRODEL and she believes that it will be a great help to her in realizing her dreams.

loans.use: to buy corn for making cooked tortillas by hand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools needed to repair electronic appliances.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es divorciada,  tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes, vive sola en una habitación alquilada en la zona Villa Fátima de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella estudio solo hasta terminar la secundaria y actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja por más de diez horas elaborando y vendiendo todo tipo de masitas como ser empanadas, galletas, panes etc. Debe cubrir los gastos de alquiler, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material para la elaboración de sus productos  como la harina y el azúcar ya que desea comprar el material por cantidad y con lo poco que gana no le alcanza.
El sueño de Elena, es tener su tienda de repostería y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos para adquirir una casa en anticrético y también mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la séptima vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Elena’s divorced and has two children who are now independent.  She lives alone in a rented room in the city of La Paz’s Villa Fátima zone.

She only completed secondary school and currently earns income working more than ten hours making and selling all sorts of baked goods like turnovers, cookies, bread rolls, etc.  She must cover her housing, food and basic utility costs.

She needs the loan to buy ingredients needed to make her products like flour and sugar since she wants to buy these supplies at wholesale but with the little she earns she can’t afford to.

Elena’s dream is to have a pastry shop to improve her income and acquire a house using the “anticrético” [a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] modality and also to improve her quality of life.

This is the seventh time she’s worked with IMPRO and the first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Reyna Noemy

texts.es:
Reina, está solicitando nuevo préstamo para poder fortalecer el negocio en la compra de telas para la fabricación de prendas de vestir, además se comprará zipper, broches, hilos, entre otros materiales necesarios para la confección de ropa, pues su objetivo es mantener un buen nivel de producción para poner a la venta el producto terminado.

El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue la ayuda a fortalecer el negocio, manteniendo todo lo necesario para no estancarse con el trabajo, con sus ganancias a podido ayudar a su familia y sus condiciones familiares se mantienen.
texts.en:
Reina is asking for a new loan to strengthen her business of buying fabrics for the creation of clothing items.  She will also buy zippers, fasteners, threads, and other materials as necessary for the creation of clothing.  Her objective is to maintain a good level of production to finish her clothing items for sale.

The effect that her previous loan had was to help strengthen her business by giving her access to all the necessary items so she would not need to stop her work.  With her profits, she has been able to help her family and maintain a good level of living for them.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, zippers, snaps and fasteners, and thread.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 46 years old, is married, and has three sons and four daughters. Her sons are attached to a tailoring business, while her daughters remain at home and support Nasreen in her household tasks.

Nasreen's husband operates a livestock business. He sells buffaloes and goats for meat, and also sells their milk to his community clients. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment he will buy a buffalo to sell in the animal market.

loans.use: to buy buffalo for her husband's livestock business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina, a 39-year-old married mother of three, lives in the Philippines where she has been selling snacks in the school near their house for five years now.  Having become a member of HSPFI this year, she is requesting a loan for PHP 3,000 to buy more snacks like biscuits and chocolates to resell. In the future, Adelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more snacks to resell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin  is a 22 year-old married man.  He has no children yet.  He describes himself to be humble man. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as sugar, salt, detergents, margarine, flour, bread, sodas etc . He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan in order to buy more household items . His business goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, his business will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more household items to resell.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby  is  35  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Ruby  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5  years. She requested a loan for  8,000 PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Ruby has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Ruby hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Wilma esta divorciada  y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa de sus padres ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la localidad de Viacha en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos, ya que trabaja en una entidad pública por más de ocho horas y a veces cubre turnos toda la noche  y con lo poco que gana  debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia, es por eso que solicita crédito ya que no le alcanza para comprar una segadora ya que en su tiempo libre se dedica  a la agricultura y a la producción de leche.
El sueño de Wilma, es mejorar sus ingresos para poder adquirir un anticrético y dar más comodidad a su familia de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que la cliente solicita crédito en IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Wilma’s divorced and has two children who are school age.  They live in her parents’ house occupying two rooms.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Viacha neighborhood.

She earns income working in a public institution for more than eight hours and sometimes covers all-night shifts.  With the little she earns she must cover food, education and basic utility costs for her family which is why she’s asking for a loan because she does not have enough to buy a harvesting machine since in her free time she also works in agriculture and in milk production.

Wilma’s dream is to improve her income and to be able to acquire an “anticrético” [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] to provide more comfort for her family thus improving their quality of life.

This is the first time she’s asked for a loan in IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a harvester.

loans.name: Ambar Isayanet

texts.es:
Ambar, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio comprándose gaseosas, jugos, granos básicos, golosinas, azúcar, jabón y detergentes, ya que son los necesarios para aumentar la variedad en el negocio, con esta inversión podra ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad para satisfacer sus necesidades.

Con el préstamo anterior logró mejorar el negocio, ya que los surtio de una mayor calidad de productos que han tenido aceptación de los clientes, en su familia sus condiciones se han mantenido, a futuro siempre tiene el deseo de tener su propia casa y ampliar más la tienda.
texts.en:
Ambar is requesting a new loan to invest in her business by buying soft drinks, juices, grains, sweets, sugar, soap and detergent, as they are needed to increase variety in her store.  With this investment, she can offer her clients more choices to satisfy their needs.

With her previous loan she was able to improve her business, which came from having a higher quality of products approved of by her clients.  She has been able to maintain her family's living conditions.  In the future, she hopes to own her own home and to further expand her store.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices, grains, sweets, sugar, soap and detergent.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 57 years old, married and lives in the Philippines.

Lydia makes school uniforms. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 4,000 in order to buy textiles for making school uniforms.

Lydia has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy textiles for making school uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline  is a 23-year-old single woman. She has a daughter who is two years old. She describes herself as a jovial woman. She operates a green grocery business where she sells potatoes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within a viable business environment  and her primary customers are restaurants and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Caroline will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more potatoes to resell. Her business goal is to run many more grocery stores within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have expanded her business.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes to resell.

loans.name: Ka

texts.en:
Ka lives at Baray district with his spouse and five single children, while the other three children have their own families. 

Ka regards himself as a hardworking farmer who devotes most of his time to cultivating seasonal crops like rice and potatoes. He has been working in this business for over 30 years and it’s been the major source of his income. Typically, he is able to make approximately USD 7.20 per day.

Now he is asking for additional capital to invest in planting potato crops. He wants to obtain USD 500 to add to his existing money to pay labor costs for preparing the land and to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides. 

Ka’s dream is to make his business more viable and profitable for the welfare of the family.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for preparing the land and to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 50 years of age and a widowed mother of seven children – two married children and five single children. 

She has been struggling in her farming business to provide enough food for the family. She owns a few hectares of farmland, which she uses to plant rice and other seasonal crops. She has been involved in this for almost 33 years and she is able to earn in the neighborhood of USD 5.00 per day.

Chea has turned to HKL for the second time to ask for a loan of USD 500 to pay for plowing fees and labor costs incurred in planting rice. 

With her generated revenue, Chea will invest in a hog-raising business to double the return in the future. A portion of the profit will be saved for the emergencies of the family.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and labor costs incurred in planting rice.

loans.name: Niv

texts.en:
Niv, 42, is a hard-working man who is always seeking the welfare of his family, providing good education for his children. He devotes his full attention to rice farming business, from which the main part of the family’s income is made. His wife is a good business partner who always helps him in the business. He has been in this business for almost 30 years. With his many-year experience, Niv is very happy that he is able to continually develop his farming practices while he operates it. At the present, Niv and his wife have four dependent children, who are still attending school.

Niv is now taking out a loan in the sum of KHR 2,000,000 to add to his capital to purchase farm supplies needed for his crop care such as chemical fertilizers and pesticides for spraying. He is confident that this loan will help him improve his business and he hopes to have an abundant harvest in following season.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies needed for his crops' care such as chemical fertilizers and pesticides for spraying.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John  is a married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 14 years. He describes himself to be a humble man. He operates a motorcycle and a blacksmith business providing transportation and blacksmith services. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located within  a viable business area  and his primary customers are local residents. 

John describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy metal for his blacksmith services. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, his business will have been successful.

loans.use: to buy metal for his blacksmith business.

loans.name: Zoila Elizabeth

texts.es:
Zoila, tiene 50 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una colonia de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. 
Doña Zoila  ha necesitado tener un ingreso para aportar al hogar pues decidió empezar a vender mercadería, ella vende ropa interior para damas, pantalones, camisas, blusas, calzado y carteras. Lo inicio con  capital propio hace 7 años. Sus ventas las realiza desde su casa y también trabaja con los clientes por encargo y entrega a domicilio. La mercadería que vende se la envían del Extranjero y esta motivada ya que sus clientes quedan satisfechos con el servicio que ella les brinda. 
Con ODEF a obtenido varios prestamos que le han ayudado mucho a invertir en el negocio, actualmente solicita otro de 24,000 lempiras para comprar un fardo de ropa americana.  Espera lograr incrementar sus ventas y surtir mas el negocio vendiendo variedad de prendas. 
Su plan es seguir ayudando a su familia con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Zoila is 50 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Doña Zoila needed income to support her household, so she decided to begin selling merchandise. She sells women’s undergarments, trousers, shirts, blouses, shoes, and purses. Zoila started with her own capital seven years ago. Her sales are conducted from her home, but she also takes orders and makes deliveries to the homes of her customers. The merchandise that she sells is shipped from abroad and she is thrilled that her customers are satisfied with the service that she provides.

The various loans that Zoila has obtained from ODEF have been a great help to her with investing in her business. She is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 24,000 HNL so that she can buy a bundle of American clothes. She hopes to increase her sales by restocking her business with more inventory. This will enable her to sell a variety of garments. Her plan is to continue helping her family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of American clothing.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto a sus tres hijos. Hace 6 años que estableció el negocio en su casa de realizar peinados especiales, tintes, cortes de pelo de damas y caballeros. De este negocio salen  los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo va invertir en la compra de productos de belleza y otra parte la invertirá en comprar de una fotocopiadora para generar otros ingresos y va reparar una lámina del techo del local del negocio. La meta es que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de continuar sus estudios. Esta agradecida por el apoyo financiero.
texts.en:
Yaneth, 36, is a single mother living in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula with her three children.  She started a home-based beauty salon six years ago where she does hair styling, hair coloring and haircuts for men and women.  She earns income in this business needed to support her family.

The loan she’s asking for will be used to buy beauty products and also to buy a photocopier to generate extra income; she will also repair one of the metal sheets on the salon’s roof.  Her goal is that her children have the opportunity to continue with their schooling.  She’s grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, a photocopier and to repair the roof.

loans.name: Benilda Cristina

texts.es: Hilo con que fabricó  hamacas y bolsos,  fue lo que Benilda compró con su credikiva anterior; ella está feliz de haberle respondido  a su clientela en la ciudad de Cartagena, donde el tejido vertical, tienen mucha acogida.  Su satisfacción con este financiamiento la lleva a agradecer infinitamente a Kiva y pide  que continúen haciéndole préstamos, porque es mucha la ayuda con la que aumenta sus ingresos, después de invertir su credikiva. En la actualidad está muy entusiasmada, porque sus pedidos han aumentado y se dispone a responderlos, por eso está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará insumos, como hilo fino para elaborar nuevas hamacas, a las cuales ha adicionado valor, con motivos especiales que a su clientela  gusta mucho y esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva sea muy exitoso y que ella continúe soñando en ser cada vez mas prospera.
texts.en:
Thread with which to make hammocks and bags is what Benilda bought with her previous loan.  She is happy to have been able to respond to customer demand in the city of Cartagena where the vertical weaving style is very well received.  Her satisfaction with this loan's results led her to give infinite thanks to Kiva nad ask that they continue giving loans to her.  This is a great help to her finances and she really increased her income after the investment of her loan.

She is currently very enthusiastic because of the increase in her requests for products and she is ready to respond to them.  That's why she is asking for a new loan with which to buy her supplies, like fine threads to make new hammocks, which will have a greater value, and with the motive of making her customers really like her products, and she hopes this will make her new loan very successful and that she will continue to become more prosperous each time she reinvests.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fine, quality threads.

loans.name: Patricia Carolina

texts.es:
Patricia, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar semilla de marañon cruda y los plásticos necesarios para poder prepararlos para la venta, esto le ayudará a tener una suficiente cantidad de productos para procesarla y salir a ofrecer a los clientes.
